feed.title: Memoir RnE
feed.subtitle: 开擺すればいいんだよ

div.p: Want to design a new Emacs color theme inspired by the color palette from the anime Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita.
Willow and poplar catkins are floating everywhere in the air throughout the city of Beijing.
Was cycling past the railway, when I heard the alert about an approaching train.
So I stopped to see what it would be like, and it turned out to be just a tiny single-car train.
The blurring sense of dissonance between the ordinary and extraordinary is truly compelling.
The extent of damage the kaiju causes to the world is never fully revealed, and the protagonists are not tasked to protect.
As for Yume, I don’t really care if she embodies a kind of traitless trait, but she’s so lovely.
Got the unlimited spell perk and the circle of transmogrification. Once I find an aiming spell modifier, I’m invincible.
Good news, my EB EE on Raymond Chandler’s The Long Goodbye is approved.
Safari handles atom feeds by attempting to open and subscribe to it with an external RSS reader, ignoring the <?xml-stylesheet?> directive.
I think it’s time to give JavaScript a try.

entry.title: Some more XSLT for my site

div.p: Just decided to write some XSLT to transform atom feed to valid HTML5 so it can be displayed in an iframe.
It feels more comfortable for me than using JavaScript, unless I missed something.
Received a very low score on my first monthly test, getting a 5 in Japanese. Lot of deadlines piling ahead.
First memoir in this feed, but I’m not sure exactly what to say. I guess this will be it for now.
